node.title: Breakers add highly experienced NBA guard as injury replacement
node.description: Chasson Randle played 41 games for Orlando Magic last season.
node.content: ["NZ Breakers have signed former NBA guard Chasson Randle to ease their injury woes and help spark their ailing Australian NBL campaign into life.", "With 119 games of NBA experience under his belt, the Breakers hope Randle, 28, can fill the void left by import Peyton Siva, who'll be sidelined for up to eight weeks with a hamstring tear.", "The Illinois native made 41 appearances for the Orlando Magic last season, with respectable averages of 6.5 points, two rebounds and almost two assists in his 20 minutes per game.", "Randle has also had stints at Philadelphia Sixers, Golden State Warriors, New York Knicks, Washington Wizards, and tasted success in Europe - helping Real Madrid to a Euroleague title in 2018.", "With the Breakers winless through their first three games of the season and plagued by injuries and off-court issues, including a COVID-19 outbreak, owner Matt Walsh believes Randle - who'll become comfortably the most experienced NBA player to ever wear a Breakers jersey - is the ideal antidote.", "\"It's been a very difficult start with COVID, with two of our imports injured, and we wanted to get the best import on the market available,\" says Walsh.", "\"Randle is a legit NBA player who has started games and played significant minutes, and we believe he's going to come in and be one of the best imports in our league.", "\"We anticipate him coming in and putting us back in the hunt.\"", "Import guard Jeremiah Martin and captain Tom Abercrombie have both recovered from their respective injuries and are expected to be back on court this weekend, and Walsh is confident the arrow is about to turn upwards for his side.", "\"We are committed to putting a championship team out for our Breakers fans,\" he says.\u00a0", "\"We have a championship roster, and we have just added a talented guy to get us over the hump.\"", "On Friday, the Breakers take on Illawarra Hawks, before squaring off with Melbourne United on Sunday."]
